article:
Otto von Bolschwing
=====================

Otto von Bolschwing was a German nobleman, Nazi Party member, and intelligence officer who played a significant role in the development of the United States' post-World War II intelligence apparatus. His life was marked by a complex web of espionage, deception, and manipulation, which ultimately led to his involvement with the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and his emigration to the United States.

Early life and Nazi career
---------------------------

### Early life and business ventures

Otto von Bolschwing was born on October 15, 1909, in Schönfließ, a small town in the province of Brandenburg, Germany. He came from a noble family and was raised in a strict, conservative household. After completing his secondary education, von Bolschwing pursued a career in business, working as a sales representative for a textile company. However, he soon became disillusioned with the monotony of his job and began to look for more exciting opportunities.

### Mandatory Palestine

In 1933, von Bolschwing traveled to Mandatory Palestine, where he became involved with the German Templers, a group of German colonizers who had settled in the region. During his time in Palestine, von Bolschwing developed strong connections with the local Jewish community, which would later become a valuable asset in his intelligence career.

### Office of Jewish Affairs

Upon his return to Germany, von Bolschwing joined the Nazi Party and began working for the Office of Jewish Affairs, a department responsible for implementing the party's anti-Semitic policies. Von Bolschwing's experience in Palestine and his connections with the Jewish community made him an ideal candidate for this role, as he was able to gather intelligence on Jewish organizations and individuals.

World War II
------------

### Romania

In 1940, von Bolschwing was assigned to Romania, where he worked as a liaison officer between the German and Romanian governments. His primary responsibility was to gather intelligence on the Romanian Jewish community and to facilitate the implementation of anti-Semitic policies in the country.

### Downfall and imprisonment

However, von Bolschwing's career in Romania was short-lived. In 1941, he was accused of being a double agent and was arrested by the Gestapo. He was imprisoned for several months but managed to escape and flee to Austria, where he went into hiding.

### Austria

In Austria, von Bolschwing assumed a new identity and began working as a businessman. He managed to keep a low profile and avoid detection by the authorities, but his past eventually caught up with him. In 1945, he was arrested by American forces and imprisoned for his involvement with the Nazi Party.

Postwar espionage
-----------------

### Gehlen Organization

After his release from prison, von Bolschwing began working for the Gehlen Organization, a private intelligence agency founded by Reinhard Gehlen, a former German General. The organization was later absorbed into the CIA, and von Bolschwing became a key figure in the development of the agency's Eastern European operations.

### Central Intelligence Agency

In 1954, von Bolschwing was recruited by the CIA, where he worked as a senior intelligence officer. He played a significant role in the agency's operations in Eastern Europe, using his connections with former Nazi officials to gather intelligence on Soviet activities.

### Cover-up

However, von Bolschwing's past soon became a liability for the CIA. In the late 1950s, the agency began to receive allegations that von Bolschwing had been involved in war crimes during his time in Romania. The agency launched an investigation, but von Bolschwing's colleagues and superiors worked to cover up his past, fearing that the scandal would damage the agency's reputation.

### Emigration to the United States

In 1959, von Bolschwing emigrated to the United States, where he settled in California. He continued to work for the CIA, using his expertise to advise on Eastern European operations.

Life in the United States
-------------------------

### Business career

In addition to his work for the CIA, von Bolschwing also pursued a successful business career. He founded a consulting firm and worked as a lobbyist, using his connections with former Nazi officials to secure contracts with the US government.

### TCI scandal

However, von Bolschwing's business career was not without controversy. In the 1970s, he became embroiled in a scandal surrounding the Transcontinental Corporation (TCI), a company that had been accused of bribing government officials. Von Bolschwing was accused of being involved in the scandal, but he denied any wrongdoing.

### Later life and investigations

In the 1980s, von Bolschwing's past finally caught up with him. The US government launched an investigation into his involvement with the Nazi Party, and he was forced to testify before Congress. Von Bolschwing died in 1982, but the controversy surrounding his life and career continued to simmer.

England at the 2022 Commonwealth Games

The 2022 Commonwealth Games, officially known as the XXII Commonwealth Games, were held in Birmingham, England, from July 28 to August 8, 2022. England was the host nation and participated in the games as one of the 72 participating Commonwealth Games Associations (CGAs). The English team consisted of a large contingent of athletes competing in various sports.

# Administration
Team England was responsible for selecting and preparing the athletes to represent England at the 2022 Commonwealth Games. The team was led by Chef de Mission Mark England, who was responsible for overseeing the entire English delegation. The English team was supported by a large team of coaches, officials, and support staff.

# Competitors
England sent a total of 416 athletes to compete in 20 sports at the 2022 Commonwealth Games. The team consisted of experienced athletes as well as newcomers, with the goal of winning medals and achieving personal bests.

# Medallists
England won a total of 176 medals at the 2022 Commonwealth Games, including 57 gold medals, 66 silver medals, and 53 bronze medals.

## Multiple medallists
Several English athletes won multiple medals at the 2022 Commonwealth Games. These athletes included:

* Adam Peaty, who won three gold medals and one silver medal in swimming
* Laura Kenny, who won two gold medals and one silver medal in cycling
* Jason Kenny, who won two gold medals and one silver medal in cycling
* Emma Raducanu, who won two gold medals and one bronze medal in tennis

# Athletics
England won a total of 13 medals in athletics at the 2022 Commonwealth Games, including three gold medals, four silver medals, and six bronze medals. The English team was led by athletes such as Dina Asher-Smith, who won the gold medal in the women's 100m, and Zharnel Hughes, who won the gold medal in the men's 100m.

England won a total of six medals in badminton at the 2022 Commonwealth Games, including two gold medals, two silver medals, and two bronze medals. The English team was led by athletes such as Marcus Ellis and Lauren Smith, who won the gold medal in the mixed doubles.

The English men's 3x3 basketball team won the bronze medal at the 2022 Commonwealth Games, defeating Australia in the third-place playoff.

The English men's wheelchair 3x3 basketball team won the silver medal at the 2022 Commonwealth Games, losing to Australia in the gold medal match.

# Beach volleyball

## Women's tournament

England won a total of seven medals in boxing at the 2022 Commonwealth Games, including two gold medals, two silver medals, and three bronze medals. The English team was led by athletes such as Delicious Orie, who won the gold medal in the men's super heavyweight, and Gemma Richardson, who won the gold medal in the women's welterweight.

The English women's cricket team won the gold medal at the 2022 Commonwealth Games, defeating India in the gold medal match.

Ben Roberts-Smith
================

Ben Roberts-Smith is a former Australian Army soldier and a recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest military honor in the Australian honors system. He is also a businessman and a public figure, having made headlines for his military career, corporate endeavors, and personal life.

Early Life and Family
--------------------

Ben Roberts-Smith was born on November 1, 1978, in Perth, Western Australia. His father, Len Roberts-Smith, was a judge of the Supreme Court of Western Australia, and his mother, Sue Roberts-Smith, was a teacher. He has two siblings, a brother, and a sister. Roberts-Smith grew up in a middle-class family and was educated at Perth's Hale School.

Roberts-Smith was an active child, participating in various sports, including rugby, cricket, and athletics. He developed an interest in the military at a young age and was influenced by his grandfather, who served in World War II. After completing his secondary education, Roberts-Smith joined the Australian Army in 1996.

Military Career
----------------

Roberts-Smith enlisted in the Australian Army in 1996 and began his military career as a rifleman in the 3rd Battalion, Royal Australian Regiment (3 RAR). He later transferred to the Special Air Service Regiment (SASR), an elite special forces unit of the Australian Army. Roberts-Smith served in the SASR for over a decade, participating in several deployments, including in East Timor, Iraq, and Afghanistan.

During his military career, Roberts-Smith distinguished himself as a skilled and courageous soldier. He was awarded numerous decorations for his service, including the Victoria Cross, the Medal for Gallantry, and the Commendation for Gallantry.

### Military Decorations

* Victoria Cross (2011)
* Medal for Gallantry (2006)
* Commendation for Gallantry (2009)
* Australian Active Service Medal
* Afghanistan Medal
* Iraq Medal
* Australian Defence Medal

Corporate Career
-----------------

After leaving the military in 2013, Roberts-Smith transitioned to a career in business. He joined the Seven Network, a major Australian television network, as the general manager of Seven Queensland. In 2015, he became the chief operating officer of the network's Queensland operations.

In 2018, Roberts-Smith joined the board of directors of the Australian Cancer Research Foundation, a non-profit organization that funds cancer research in Australia. He has also been involved in various other business ventures, including a stint as a director of a private security company.

Other Activities
----------------

Roberts-Smith has been involved in various charitable and community activities throughout his career. He has supported several organizations, including the Royal Australian Regiment's charity, the Australian War Memorial, and the SAS Resources Trust.

In 2019, Roberts-Smith was appointed as the chairman of the Prime Minister's Veterans' Employment Initiative, a program aimed at supporting the employment of veterans in the Australian workforce.

War Crime Allegations
----------------------

In 2020, Roberts-Smith became embroiled in controversy when allegations of war crimes emerged against him. The allegations, which were first reported by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC), related to the killing of Afghan civilians during a SASR operation in 2012.

### Investigation

The Australian Defence Force (ADF) launched an investigation into the allegations, which was led by the Australian Federal Police (AFP). The investigation, which was ongoing as of 2022, has been the subject of much controversy, with some critics accusing the ADF of mishandling the inquiry.

Defamation Suit
----------------

In 2020, Roberts-Smith launched a defamation suit against the ABC and several of its journalists over the publication of the war crime allegations. The suit, which was filed in the Federal Court of Australia, alleged that the ABC had published false and defamatory material about Roberts-Smith.

### Judgment

In 2022, the Federal Court delivered a judgment in the defamation case, dismissing Roberts-Smith's claims. The court found that the ABC had published the allegations in good faith and that the material was not defamatory.

### Appeal

Roberts-Smith has appealed the judgment, with the case set to be heard by the Full Court of the Federal Court in 2023.

Further Controversy
----------------------

Roberts-Smith has been involved in further controversy in recent years, including a public dispute with the ABC over the war crime allegations. In 2020, he was also criticized for his involvement in a private security company that had been accused of providing services to a Chinese state-owned company.

-------------

Super Bowl LVII

Super Bowl LVII was the 57th edition of the Super Bowl, the annual championship game of the National Football League (NFL). The game was played on February 12, 2023, at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona. The Kansas City Chiefs defeated the Philadelphia Eagles by a score of 38-35, capturing their second Super Bowl title in four years.

# Background

## Host selection

In May 2018, the NFL announced that State Farm Stadium would host Super Bowl LVII. The stadium, located in Glendale, Arizona, had previously hosted Super Bowl XLII and Super Bowl XLIX. The selection was made after a bidding process, with the Arizona Super Bowl Host Committee submitting a successful bid to host the game.

## Calls for location change

In the months leading up to the game, there were calls to relocate Super Bowl LVII due to concerns about the treatment of Native American communities in Arizona. The state had recently passed laws that critics argued were discriminatory towards Native Americans, leading to a backlash from some NFL fans and sponsors. However, the NFL ultimately decided to keep the game in Arizona, citing a commitment to using the event as a platform for promoting social justice and awareness.

## Indigenous representation

In response to the criticism, the NFL and the Arizona Super Bowl Host Committee made a concerted effort to incorporate indigenous representation into the game and surrounding events. This included the inclusion of Native American performers and artists in the pre-game and halftime shows, as well as the recognition of Native American veterans during the game.

## Stadium playing surface

In the weeks leading up to the game, there were concerns about the condition of the playing surface at State Farm Stadium. The stadium's grass field had been replaced with a new surface, but some players and coaches expressed concerns about its quality. However, the NFL and the stadium's management assured that the surface was safe and suitable for play.

# Teams

Led by quarterback Patrick Mahomes, the Chiefs had a high-powered offense that averaged over 30 points per game. They defeated the Jacksonville Jaguars and the Cincinnati Bengals in the playoffs to advance to the Super Bowl.

## Philadelphia Eagles

The Philadelphia Eagles entered Super Bowl LVII as the first seed in the NFC, having finished the regular season with a 14-3 record. Led by quarterback Jalen Hurts, the Eagles had a strong offense and a stout defense that allowed just 20 points per game. They defeated the New York Giants and the San Francisco 49ers in the playoffs to advance to the Super Bowl.

## Playoffs

The playoffs leading up to Super Bowl LVII were marked by several exciting games and upsets. The Chiefs came from behind to defeat the Jaguars in the divisional round, while the Eagles dominated the Giants in the divisional round. The Chiefs then defeated the Bengals in the AFC Championship Game, while the Eagles defeated the 49ers in the NFC Championship Game.

## Pre-game notes

The Chiefs were seeking their second Super Bowl title in four years, while the Eagles were seeking their second title in franchise history. The game was also notable for the matchup between Mahomes and Hurts, two of the most dynamic quarterbacks in the NFL.

article:
Impeachment Inquiry into Joe Biden
=====================================

The impeachment inquiry into Joe Biden refers to the investigation conducted by the United States Congress into the conduct of Joe Biden, the 46th President of the United States. The inquiry was initiated in 2023, and it has been a highly politicized and contentious issue.

Background
----------

The impeachment inquiry into Joe Biden was initiated amidst allegations of misconduct and abuse of power. The allegations centered on Biden's handling of foreign policy, particularly with regards to Ukraine and China. Critics of the President argued that he had used his executive authority to further his own personal interests, rather than the interests of the United States.

Additionally, Biden's administration had faced criticism for its handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, the economy, and social justice issues. Many Republicans had expressed frustration with the President's policies and had called for greater accountability.

Initiation of the Inquiry
-------------------------

The impeachment inquiry into Joe Biden was formally initiated in March 2023, when a group of Republican lawmakers introduced a resolution calling for an investigation into the President's conduct. The resolution was referred to the House Judiciary Committee, which began conducting hearings and gathering evidence.

House Committee Investigations
-----------------------------

The House Judiciary Committee, led by Chairman Jim Jordan, conducted a series of hearings and interviews with witnesses. The committee also issued subpoenas for documents and testimony from various individuals, including administration officials and private citizens.

One of the key areas of focus for the committee was the President's interactions with foreign leaders, particularly Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky. The committee sought to determine whether Biden had used his executive authority to pressure Zelensky into investigating his political opponents.

Witness Credibility
-------------------

One of the key witnesses in the impeachment inquiry was Alexander Smirnov, a former Ukrainian diplomat. Smirnov testified before the House Judiciary Committee, alleging that Biden had used his executive authority to pressure Zelensky into investigating his political opponents.

However, Smirnov's credibility as a witness was called into question by many Democrats. They argued that Smirnov had a history of making false statements and that his testimony was motivated by a desire for revenge against the Biden administration.

## Alexander Smirnov

Alexander Smirnov is a former Ukrainian diplomat who served as the deputy head of the Ukrainian embassy in Washington, D.C. Smirnov was a key witness in the impeachment inquiry, testifying before the House Judiciary Committee about his interactions with President Biden.

Smirnov alleged that Biden had used his executive authority to pressure Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky into investigating his political opponents. However, many Democrats questioned Smirnov's credibility, pointing out that he had a history of making false statements.

Responses
----------

The impeachment inquiry into Joe Biden elicited a range of responses from different groups and individuals.

## Republican Reaction

Many Republicans welcomed the impeachment inquiry, seeing it as an opportunity to hold the President accountable for his actions. Republican lawmakers argued that the inquiry was necessary to ensure that the President was not abusing his executive authority.

## Democratic Reaction

Democrats were largely critical of the impeachment inquiry, viewing it as a partisan attack on the President. Many Democrats argued that the inquiry was motivated by a desire to undermine the President's authority and to distract from more pressing issues.

## Reaction from Academics

Many academics and constitutional experts weighed in on the impeachment inquiry, offering their analysis of the President's actions and the constitutional implications of the inquiry. Some experts argued that the President's actions were impeachable, while others argued that the inquiry was a partisan overreach.

Analysis
--------

The impeachment inquiry into Joe Biden raises a number of complex constitutional and legal issues.

## Legal Standing

One of the key questions surrounding the impeachment inquiry is whether the President's actions meet the constitutional standard for impeachment. The Constitution states that the President can be impeached for "treason, bribery, or other high crimes and misdemeanors."

Many experts argue that the President's actions do not meet this standard, and that the inquiry is therefore a partisan overreach. However, others argue that the President's actions are impeachable, and that the inquiry is necessary to hold him accountable.

Opinion Polling
----------------

The impeachment inquiry into Joe Biden has been the subject of numerous opinion polls, which have sought to gauge public opinion on the issue.

## Support for Inquiry

Many polls have found that a majority of Americans support the impeachment inquiry, with some polls showing that as many as 60% of Americans believe that the inquiry is necessary.

## Support for Impeachment

However, support for impeachment itself is more divided, with many polls showing that Americans are split on the issue. Some polls have found that as many as 50% of Americans believe that the President should be impeached, while others have found that as few as 30% believe that impeachment is necessary.

Outcome
--------

The outcome of the impeachment inquiry into Joe Biden is uncertain, and it is unclear whether the President will ultimately be impeached.

However, regardless of the outcome, the inquiry has already had a significant impact on American politics, highlighting the deep divisions and partisan rancor that exist in the country.

Notes
------

This article is a factual summary of the impeachment inquiry into Joe Biden, and it does not express a opinion or bias.

article:
SOS (SZA album)

SOS is the second studio album by American singer-songwriter SZA, released on December 9, 2022, through Top Dawg Entertainment and RCA Records. The album marks SZA's first full-length project in over five years, following her critically acclaimed debut album Ctrl (2017). SOS features guest appearances from Don Toliver, Phoebe Bridgers, and Ol' Dirty Bastard, among others.

#Background

SZA began working on SOS in 2019, shortly after the release of her Ctrl deluxe edition. She had initially planned to release the album in 2020, but the COVID-19 pandemic and personal struggles delayed the project. During this time, SZA took a break from music and focused on her mental health and self-care. In 2021, she returned to the studio and started creating new music, experimenting with different sounds and styles.

#Writing and production

SZA wrote or co-wrote all 23 tracks on SOS, often drawing inspiration from her personal experiences, relationships, and emotions. The album features production from a variety of collaborators, including Rodney Jerkins, Don Toliver, and Carter Lang. SZA also worked with Ctrl producers Craig Balmoris and Scum, who contributed to several tracks on the album.

The writing and production process for SOS was often spontaneous and intuitive. SZA has said that she would often record vocals and melodies in a single take, without prior planning or preparation. This approach allowed her to tap into her emotions and create music that was raw and honest.

#Composition

SOS is a genre-bending album that incorporates elements of R&B, hip-hop, electronic, and indie rock music. The album features a mix of upbeat and slow tempos, with SZA's soulful vocals and introspective lyrics taking center stage.

The album's sound is characterized by its heavy use of bass, atmospheric synths, and distorted guitar riffs. SZA also incorporates samples and interpolations from various sources, including classic hip-hop tracks and indie rock songs.

#Title and artwork

The title SOS is an acronym for "SZA's Overthinking Shit," a phrase that reflects the album's themes of anxiety, relationships, and self-discovery. The album's artwork features a photo of SZA taken by her friend and collaborator, Sam McKnight. The image shows SZA with a contemplative expression, surrounded by a halo of light.

#Promotion

SZA announced the release of SOS on November 30, 2022, via social media. She also shared a series of promotional videos and teasers, featuring snippets from the album and behind-the-scenes footage from the recording process.

In support of the album, SZA embarked on a headlining tour in 2023, with dates in North America, Europe, and Australia. The tour featured a stripped-down setlist and intimate performances, with SZA accompanied by a live band and backing vocalists.

#Critical reception

##Reviews

SOS received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. Reviewers praised SZA's vocal performance, lyrical honesty, and genre-bending sound. Many critics noted that the album marked a significant departure from SZA's earlier work, with a more experimental and introspective approach.

Rolling Stone described SOS as "a masterpiece of modern R&B," while The New York Times praised SZA's "prodigious vocal talent" and " emotionally charged songwriting." Pitchfork called the album "a triumph of introspection and innovation," while The Guardian noted that SZA "has never sounded more confident or inventive."

##Year-end rankings

SOS appeared on numerous year-end lists, including Rolling Stone's 50 Best Albums of 2022 and Pitchfork's 50 Best Albums of 2022. The album also ranked on The New York Times' 10 Best Albums of 2022 and The Guardian's 50 Best Albums of 2022.

#Awards

SOS has been nominated for several awards, including the Grammy Award for Album of the Year and the BET Award for Album of the Year. SZA also won the BET Award for Best Female Hip-Hop/Rap Artist in 2023.

#Commercial performance

SOS debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart, with 318,000 album-equivalent units earned in its first week. The album also reached number one on the UK Albums Chart and the Australian Albums Chart.

The album spawned several successful singles, including "Kill Bill," "Snooze," and "Nobody Gets Me." "Kill Bill" reached number one on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart, becoming SZA's first number-one single.

2023 PDC World Darts Championship

The 2023 PDC World Darts Championship was the 30th edition of the Professional Darts Corporation's (PDC) annual World Darts Championship, a premier international darts competition that was held from December 15, 2022, to January 3, 2023, at the Alexandra Palace in London, England.

# Overview

The tournament featured 96 players from around the world competing in a knockout format, with the winner being crowned the world champion. The championship was the culmination of the 2022 PDC ProTour, which consisted of a series of tournaments held throughout the year.

## Prize money

The total prize fund for the 2023 PDC World Darts Championship was £2.5 million, with the winner receiving £500,000. The runner-up received £250,000, while the semi-finalists received £100,000 each.

## Format

The tournament was played in a knockout format, with each match being played over a best-of-sets format. The first round was played over the best of five sets, with the second round being played over the best of seven sets. The third round and beyond were played over the best of seven sets, with the exception of the final, which was played over the best of 13 sets.

# Qualification

The qualification process for the 2023 PDC World Darts Championship was based on the PDC ProTour Order of Merit, with the top 32 players qualifying automatically. A further 32 players qualified through the ProTour Order of Merit, while 32 international players qualified through various qualifying events.

## Seeds

The top 32 players in the PDC ProTour Order of Merit were seeded in the tournament, with the top 16 seeds being placed in the top half of the draw and the bottom 16 seeds being placed in the bottom half.

## Pro Tour qualification

The next 32 players in the PDC ProTour Order of Merit qualified for the tournament, with these players being placed in the draw alongside the seeded players.

## International qualifiers

32 international players qualified for the tournament through various qualifying events, including the PDC World Cup of Darts, the PDC World Youth Championship, and the PDC Qualifying School.

## List of qualifiers

* ProTour qualifiers: Jermaine Wattimena, Vincent van der Voort, John Henderson, Steve West, Ricky Evans, Ryan Joyce, William O'Connor, and Ross Smith.
* International qualifiers: Benito van de Pas, Toni Alcinas, Zoran Lerchbacher, and Jan Dekker.

# Summary

## Opening rounds

The tournament began on December 15, 2022, with the first round being played over the best of five sets. The seeded players dominated the opening rounds, with only a few upsets occurring.

## Third round

The third round saw some of the seeded players face stiffer competition, with several matches going to a deciding set. Michael van Gerwen and Peter Wright both won their matches comfortably, while Gerwyn Price and Michael Smith both faced tougher tests.

## Fourth round

The fourth round saw the remaining seeded players face off against each other, with several high-quality matches taking place. Michael van Gerwen and Gerwyn Price both won their matches comfortably, while Peter Wright and Michael Smith both faced tougher tests.

## Quarter-finals

The quarter-finals saw the remaining players face off against each other, with several high-quality matches taking place. Michael van Gerwen and Gerwyn Price both won their matches comfortably, while Peter Wright and Michael Smith both faced tougher tests.

## Semi-finals

The semi-finals saw Michael van Gerwen face off against Gerwyn Price, while Peter Wright faced off against Michael Smith. Both matches were high-quality, with Michael van Gerwen and Peter Wright both winning their matches to advance to the final.

## Final

The final saw Michael van Gerwen face off against Peter Wright, with the match being played over the best of 13 sets. The match was high-quality, with both players producing some excellent darts. In the end, Michael van Gerwen emerged victorious, winning the match 7-6.

2022 World Men's Curling Championship

The 2022 World Men's Curling Championship was a men's curling tournament held from April 2 to 10, 2022, in Las Vegas, United States. This marked the first time the event was held in the United States since 2008.

The 2022 World Men's Curling Championship featured 13 teams from around the world, with the majority coming from Europe and North America. The qualification process involved a combination of automatic berths, earned through performances at previous world championships, and a qualification event held in January 2022.

Due to the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine, the World Curling Federation (WCF) banned Russian teams from competing in the championship. As a result, the Russian men's curling team, which had qualified for the event, was replaced by the Czech Republic.

article:
The Kashmir Files
================

The Kashmir Files is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language drama film written and directed by Vivek Agnihotri. The film is based on the exodus of Kashmiri Hindus from Kashmir in the 1990s and explores the themes of terrorism, politics, and human rights. The film has been a subject of controversy and debate, with some praising its portrayal of the Kashmiri Hindu experience and others criticizing its handling of sensitive historical events.

Plot
-----

The film follows the story of Krishna Pandit, a young Kashmiri Hindu man who sets out to uncover the truth about the death of his grandfather, a renowned professor who was killed by terrorists in Kashmir. As Krishna delves deeper into the events surrounding his grandfather's death, he discovers a complex web of terrorism, politics, and human rights abuses that led to the exodus of Kashmiri Hindus from the region. The film weaves together a narrative that spans several decades, from the 1980s to the present day, and explores the experiences of Kashmiri Hindus, Muslims, and other communities caught up in the conflict.

Cast
-----

* Anupam Kher as Pushkar Nath Pandit, Krishna's grandfather
* Darshan Kumar as Krishna Pandit
* Mithun Chakraborty as IAS Brahma Dutt
* Pallavi Joshi as Radhika Menon
* Bhasha Sumbli as Sharda Pandit, Krishna's mother
* Chinmay Mandlekar as Farooq Malik, a terrorist
* Puneet Issar as DGP Hari Narain

Production
----------

The Kashmir Files was produced by Abhishek Agarwal Arts and Zee Studios. The film was shot on location in various parts of India, including Kashmir, Delhi, and Mumbai. The screenplay was written by Vivek Agnihotri and Saurabh M Pandey, and the music was composed by Rohit Sharma. The film's cinematography was handled by Udaysingh Mohite, and the editing was done by Shankh Rajadhyaksha.

Release
-------

### Certification

The Kashmir Files was certified UA (Universal Adult) by the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) in India.

### Litigations

The film was the subject of several litigations before its release. A petition was filed in the Delhi High Court seeking a stay on the film's release, alleging that it promoted hate speech and violence against Muslims. The court dismissed the petition, ruling that the film did not promote hate speech or violence.

### Theatrical release

The Kashmir Files was released in theaters across India on March 11, 2022. The film received a mixed response from audiences, with some praising its portrayal of the Kashmiri Hindu experience and others criticizing its handling of sensitive historical events.

### Home media

The film was released on the streaming platform ZEE5 on May 13, 2022.

Government and ruling party support
----------------------------------

The Kashmir Files received support from the Indian government and the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). The film was screened at the Rashtrapati Bhavan, the official residence of the President of India, and was attended by several high-ranking government officials. The BJP also organized screenings of the film across the country, with several party leaders praising its portrayal of the Kashmiri Hindu experience.

Reception
----------

### Critical reception

The Kashmir Files received mixed reviews from critics. Some praised the film's portrayal of the Kashmiri Hindu experience and its handling of sensitive historical events, while others criticized its handling of sensitive historical events and its perceived bias towards the BJP.

### International Film Festival of India

The Kashmir Files was screened at the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa in November 2022. The film was part of the "Indian Panorama" section of the festival, which showcases the best of Indian cinema.

### Reception by Kashmiri Pandits

The Kashmir Files received a positive response from Kashmiri Pandits, who praised the film's portrayal of their experiences during the exodus from Kashmir in the 1990s. Several Kashmiri Pandit organizations and individuals praised the film, with some calling it a " tribute to the sacrifices of Kashmiri Pandits".

Political messaging and historical accuracy
---------------------------------------------

The Kashmir Files has been accused of promoting a biased and inaccurate portrayal of historical events. Some critics have argued that the film distorts the facts of the Kashmiri Hindu exodus and promotes a Hindu nationalist agenda. Others have praised the film's handling of sensitive historical events, arguing that it provides a much-needed perspective on the experiences of Kashmiri Hindus.

Hate speech
------------

The Kashmir Files has been accused of promoting hate speech and violence against Muslims. Some critics have argued that the film's portrayal of Muslims is negative and stereotypical, and that it promotes a divisive and hate-filled agenda. Others have argued that the film does not promote hate speech or violence, and that it provides a nuanced and balanced portrayal of the complex issues involved.

Box office
----------

The Kashmir Files performed moderately well at the box office, grossing over ₹340 crore (US$43 million) worldwide. The film's success was seen as a significant achievement, given its sensitive subject matter and the controversy surrounding its release.

Accolades
----------

The Kashmir Files received several awards and nominations, including the National Film Award for Best Film on Social Issues. The film's director, Vivek Agnihotri, received the Padma Shri award for his contribution to Indian cinema.

Soundtrack
------------

Tornado outbreak of March 24–27, 2023

A significant tornado outbreak occurred across the Southern United States from March 24 to 27, 2023, affecting multiple states, including Mississippi, Georgia, and Alabama. The outbreak produced at least 131 tornadoes, resulting in widespread damage and loss of life. This article provides a comprehensive overview of the meteorological conditions that led to the outbreak, the confirmed tornadoes, non-tornadic effects, and the aftermath of the event.

# Meteorological synopsis

The tornado outbreak of March 24–27, 2023, was the result of a complex weather pattern involving a strong low-pressure system, a cold front, and a dry line. The combination of these factors created a highly unstable atmosphere, conducive to the development of severe thunderstorms and tornadoes.

## March 24–25

On March 24, a strong low-pressure system developed over the Great Plains, bringing with it a cold front and a dry line. As the system moved eastward, it encountered a warm and moist air mass from the Gulf of Mexico, creating a highly unstable atmosphere. This led to the development of severe thunderstorms across the Southern United States, including Mississippi, Alabama, and Georgia.

## March 26–27

On March 26, the low-pressure system continued to move eastward, bringing the cold front and dry line into the Southeastern United States. This led to the development of a strong squall line, which produced numerous tornadoes across the region. The storms were fueled by strong wind shear and a highly unstable atmosphere, resulting in long-lived and intense tornadoes.

# Confirmed tornadoes

article:
2022 Swedish General Election

The 2022 Swedish general election was held on 11 September 2022 to elect the 349 members of the Riksdag, the national legislative body of Sweden. The election was a significant event in Swedish politics, marking a shift in the country's political landscape.

# Background

## Löfven's Government

The 2018 Swedish general election had resulted in a hung parliament, with the Social Democratic Party (SAP) emerging as the largest party. Stefan Löfven, the leader of the SAP, formed a coalition government with the Green Party (MP) and received support from the Left Party (V) and the Centre Party (C) in the Riksdag. However, the government was weakened by internal conflicts and disagreements over policy issues. In June 2021, Löfven resigned as Prime Minister after losing a vote of no confidence in the Riksdag.

## Andersson's Government

Following Löfven's resignation, Magdalena Andersson, the leader of the SAP, formed a new government with the Green Party (MP). Andersson's government was also a minority government and relied on the support of the Left Party (V) and the Centre Party (C) to pass legislation in the Riksdag. However, the government was short-lived, and Andersson resigned as Prime Minister in September 2022 after losing a vote of no confidence in the Riksdag.

# Electoral System

The Swedish electoral system is based on proportional representation, with voters casting ballots for a party or a candidate within a party. The 349 members of the Riksdag are elected from 29 constituencies, with each constituency allocated a number of seats based on its population.

## Political Parties

Eight parties were represented in the Riksdag prior to the 2022 election:

1. Social Democratic Party (SAP)
2. Moderate Party (M)
3. Sweden Democrats (SD)
4. Centre Party (C)
5. Left Party (V)
6. Christian Democrats (KD)
7. Liberal Party (L)
8. Green Party (MP)

## Pre-election Composition

# Campaign

The 2022 Swedish general election campaign was marked by intense debate and discussion on key issues such as climate change, immigration, and economic policy.

## Issues

The main issues in the campaign were:

1. Climate change: The Green Party (MP) and the Left Party (V) emphasized the need for urgent action to address climate change, while the Sweden Democrats (SD) and the Moderate Party (M) were more skeptical about the need for radical measures.
2. Immigration: The Sweden Democrats (SD) and the Moderate Party (M) advocated for stricter immigration policies, while the Social Democratic Party (SAP) and the Green Party (MP) argued for a more liberal approach.
3. Economic policy: The Social Democratic Party (SAP) and the Left Party (V) advocated for increased public spending and taxation, while the Moderate Party (M) and the Centre Party (C) argued for reduced public spending and lower taxes.

## Party Campaigns

Each party launched its own campaign, with the Social Democratic Party (SAP) focusing on its record in government and the Moderate Party (M) emphasizing its commitment to economic reform. The Sweden Democrats (SD) launched a populist campaign, emphasizing the need for stricter immigration policies and increased law and order.

## Slogans

Some notable slogans from the campaign were:

* Social Democratic Party (SAP): "For a better Sweden"
* Moderate Party (M): "A new direction for Sweden"
* Sweden Democrats (SD): "Sweden first"
* Green Party (MP): "For the climate, for the future"

## Debates

Several debates were held during the campaign, including a televised debate between the leaders of the eight parties represented in the Riksdag. The debates were marked by intense discussion and disagreement on key issues.

# Opinion Polls

Opinion polls were conducted throughout the campaign, with the Social Democratic Party (SAP) and the Moderate Party (M) consistently polling as the two largest parties. The Sweden Democrats (SD) also polled strongly, while the Green Party (MP) and the Left Party (V) struggled to gain traction.

The aftermath of the election was marked by intense discussion and negotiation over the formation of a new government.

article:
Kang Full is a renowned South Korean cartoonist and webtoon creator, celebrated for his distinctive art style and engaging storytelling. With a career spanning over two decades, Kang Full has become one of the most influential figures in the Korean webtoon industry, known for his versatility and innovative approach to the medium.

# Early life and education

Kang Full was born on July 12, 1974, in Seoul, South Korea. Growing up, Kang was an avid reader of comic books and manga, which sparked his interest in becoming a cartoonist. He attended Hongik University, where he studied Fine Arts and honed his drawing skills. During his university days, Kang was heavily influenced by the works of Japanese manga artists, such as Hayao Miyazaki and Rumiko Takahashi.

# Career

## Early career

Kang Full began his career in the late 1990s, working as a freelance cartoonist for various Korean comic book publishers. He gained recognition for his unique art style, which blended traditional Korean motifs with modern elements. In the early 2000s, Kang started creating webtoons, which quickly gained popularity among Korean readers.

## Career breakthrough

Kang Full's breakthrough came in 2005 with the publication of his webtoon series "Apartment". The series, which told the story of a group of young adults living together in a Seoul apartment, became a huge hit among Korean readers. The success of "Apartment" established Kang Full as a leading figure in the Korean webtoon industry.

## Serialized fiction webtoons

Kang Full is known for his serialized fiction webtoons, which often explore themes of love, relationships, and social issues. His webtoons are typically characterized by their complex storylines, well-developed characters, and nuanced exploration of human emotions.

## Kang's action series: Moving, Bridge, and Hidden

In addition to his serialized fiction webtoons, Kang Full has also created several action-oriented series, including "Moving", "Bridge", and "Hidden". These series showcase Kang's ability to craft engaging action sequences and suspenseful storylines.

# Other work

## Children picture books

Kang Full has also ventured into creating children's picture books, which have been well-received by both children and adults. His picture books often feature whimsical illustrations and engaging storylines that promote social values and emotional intelligence.

## The Kang Full Cartoon Alley

In 2019, Kang Full opened "The Kang Full Cartoon Alley", a cartoon-themed cafe and exhibition space in Seoul. The cafe features exhibits of Kang's artwork, as well as interactive installations and merchandise.

# Working style

## Art Style/Technique and materials

Kang Full's art style is characterized by his use of bold lines, vibrant colors, and intricate details. He typically works with digital tools, using software such as Adobe Photoshop and Clip Studio Paint. Kang is known for his meticulous attention to detail, often spending hours perfecting a single page of artwork.

## Kang Full Universe

Kang Full has created a vast and intricate universe of characters, stories, and settings, which are interconnected across his various webtoons and series. This universe, which Kang refers to as the "Kang Full Universe", is characterized by its richly detailed world-building and complex mythology.

# Personal life

Kang Full is married to a fellow cartoonist and has two children. He is known for his down-to-earth personality and is active on social media, where he engages with fans and shares his creative process.

# Works

## Daily/weekly strips webtoons

* "Apartment" (2005-2007)
* "Moving" (2008-2010)
* "Bridge" (2011-2013)
* "Hidden" (2014-2016)

## Serial webtoons

* "The Queen's Orangery" (2017-2019)
* "The Ghost Tower" (2020-ongoing)

## Published manhwa

* "The Apartment" (2007)
* "Moving" (2010)
* "Bridge" (2013)
* "Hidden" (2016)

## Children picture books

* "The Magic Paintbrush" (2019)

# Screen and stage adaptations

## Film

## Television and web series

* "The Ghost Tower" (2022) - a Korean web series adaptation of Kang's webtoon series

## Theater and musical

* "Apartment" (2018) - a Korean musical adaptation of Kang's webtoon series

# Accolades

article:
Government and intergovernmental reactions to the Russian invasion of Ukraine

The Russian invasion of Ukraine, which began in February 2022, has sparked a significant reaction from governments and intergovernmental organizations around the world. The international community has been closely monitoring the situation, with many countries condemning Russia's actions and calling for a peaceful resolution to the conflict.

# Ukraine

The Ukrainian government has been at the forefront of the international response to the invasion, calling for support from its allies and partners. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has been a vocal advocate for Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity, and has met with world leaders to discuss the crisis. The Ukrainian government has also imposed martial law and mobilized its military in response to the invasion.

# Russia

The Russian government has defended its actions in Ukraine, claiming that it is protecting the rights of Russian-speaking citizens and preventing a humanitarian crisis. President Vladimir Putin has stated that Russia's goal is to "demilitarize and denazify" Ukraine, and has accused the Ukrainian government of being fascist and corrupt. Russia has also imposed its own sanctions on Ukraine and has restricted the movement of Ukrainian citizens.

# Other countries

The international community has been divided in its response to the invasion, with some countries condemning Russia's actions and others remaining neutral or supporting Russia.

## Condemns Russia

Many countries have condemned Russia's invasion of Ukraine, calling it a violation of international law and a threat to global security. These countries include:

* The United States, which has imposed sanctions on Russia and provided military aid to Ukraine
* The United Kingdom, which has also imposed sanctions and provided humanitarian aid to Ukraine
* Canada, which has imposed sanctions and provided military aid to Ukraine
* Australia, which has imposed sanctions and provided humanitarian aid to Ukraine
* Germany, which has imposed sanctions and provided economic aid to Ukraine
* France, which has imposed sanctions and provided military aid to Ukraine

### Governments in exile

Some governments in exile have also condemned Russia's actions in Ukraine. These include:

* The Belarusian opposition, which has called for an end to the invasion and the restoration of democracy in Belarus
* The Kazakh opposition, which has called for an end to the invasion and the protection of human rights in Kazakhstan

### Non UN members

Some non-UN member states have also condemned Russia's actions in Ukraine. These include:

* Taiwan, which has called for an end to the invasion and the protection of human rights in Ukraine
* Kosovo, which has called for an end to the invasion and the recognition of Kosovo's sovereignty

## Leans to Ukraine

Some countries have leaned towards supporting Ukraine in the conflict, but have not imposed sanctions on Russia. These countries include:

* Italy, which has provided humanitarian aid to Ukraine and called for a peaceful resolution to the conflict
* Spain, which has provided humanitarian aid to Ukraine and called for a peaceful resolution to the conflict
* Sweden, which has provided humanitarian aid to Ukraine and called for a peaceful resolution to the conflict
* Switzerland, which has provided humanitarian aid to Ukraine and called for a peaceful resolution to the conflict

## Neutral countries

Some countries have remained neutral in the conflict, calling for a peaceful resolution and avoiding taking sides. These countries include:

* China, which has called for a peaceful resolution to the conflict and avoided taking sides
* India, which has called for a peaceful resolution to the conflict and avoided taking sides
* South Africa, which has called for a peaceful resolution to the conflict and avoided taking sides
* Brazil, which has called for a peaceful resolution to the conflict and avoided taking sides

### Non UN members

Some non-UN member states have also remained neutral in the conflict. These include:

* The Holy See, which has called for a peaceful resolution to the conflict and avoided taking sides
* The Palestinian Authority, which has called for a peaceful resolution to the conflict and avoided taking sides

## Leans to Russia

Some countries have leaned towards supporting Russia in the conflict, but have not imposed sanctions on Ukraine. These countries include:

* Belarus, which has provided military aid to Russia and called for an end to the conflict
* Kazakhstan, which has provided military aid to Russia and called for an end to the conflict
* Kyrgyzstan, which has provided military aid to Russia and called for an end to the conflict
* Tajikistan, which has provided military aid to Russia and called for an end to the conflict

### Non UN members

Some non-UN member states have also leaned towards supporting Russia in the conflict. These include:

* Abkhazia, which has provided military aid to Russia and called for an end to the conflict
* South Ossetia, which has provided military aid to Russia and called for an end to the conflict

## Supports Russia

Some countries have openly supported Russia in the conflict, imposing sanctions on Ukraine and providing military aid to Russia. These countries include:

* Syria, which has imposed sanctions on Ukraine and provided military aid to Russia
* North Korea, which has imposed sanctions on Ukraine and provided military aid to Russia
* Cuba, which has imposed sanctions on Ukraine and provided military aid to Russia
* Nicaragua, which has imposed sanctions on Ukraine and provided military aid to Russia

### Non UN members

Some non-UN member states have also openly supported Russia in the conflict. These include:

* The Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic, which has imposed sanctions on Ukraine and provided military aid to Russia
* The Republic of Artsakh, which has imposed sanctions on Ukraine and provided military aid to Russia

# Expulsion of diplomats

Several countries have expelled Russian diplomats in response to the invasion, including:

* The United States, which has expelled 12 Russian diplomats
* The United Kingdom, which has expelled 23 Russian diplomats
* Canada, which has expelled 40 Russian diplomats
* Australia, which has expelled 2 Russian diplomats
* Germany, which has expelled 40 Russian diplomats
* France, which has expelled 35 Russian diplomats

# Intergovernmental and international organizations

Several intergovernmental and international organizations have condemned Russia's actions in Ukraine, including:

## NATO

The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) has condemned Russia's actions in Ukraine, calling it a "clear violation of international law". NATO has also provided military aid to Ukraine and has increased its military presence in Eastern Europe.

## European Union

The European Union (EU) has condemned Russia's actions in Ukraine, calling it a "grave violation of international law". The EU has also imposed sanctions on Russia and has provided economic aid to Ukraine.

## International Criminal Court

The International Criminal Court (ICC) has opened an investigation into war crimes committed during the conflict, including allegations of Russian war crimes.

# See also

* Russian invasion of Ukraine
* Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation
* War in Donbass
* Minsk agreements

# Notes

This article is a summary of the government and intergovernmental reactions to the Russian invasion of Ukraine. It is not a comprehensive list of all reactions, but rather a selection of notable examples.

# References

This article does not include references.

article:
2021–2023 ICC World Test Championship

The 2021–2023 ICC World Test Championship was the second edition of the ICC World Test Championship, a biennial Test cricket tournament organised by the International Cricket Council (ICC). The tournament began on 4 August 2021 and concluded on 11 June 2023.

Format
--------

The tournament featured the top nine Test teams competing in a league format, with each team playing six series, three at home and three away. The teams earned points based on their performance in each series, with the top two teams qualifying for the final.

Points System
-------------

The points system for the tournament was as follows:

* 12 points for a win
* 6 points for a draw
* 0 points for a loss
* 4 points for a draw where the teams were level on points at the end of the match (i.e., a tied match)

In addition, teams earned bonus points for winning series. A team that won a series 2-0 earned 24 points, while a team that won a series 2-1 earned 18 points.

Participants
------------

The following nine teams participated in the tournament:

* Australia
* Bangladesh
* England
* India
* New Zealand
* Pakistan
* South Africa
* Sri Lanka
* West Indies

Broadcasters
------------

The tournament was broadcast by various television networks around the world, including:

* Star Sports (India)
* Sky Sports (United Kingdom)
* Fox Sports (Australia)
* SuperSport (South Africa)
* PTV Sports (Pakistan)
* Gazi TV (Bangladesh)
* Sky Sport (New Zealand)
* ESPN (Caribbean)

Schedule
---------

The schedule for the tournament was as follows:

* 4 August 2021 – 14 June 2023: League stage
* 7-11 June 2023: Final

Prize Money
------------

The total prize money for the tournament was $3.8 million, with the winning team earning $1.6 million and the runners-up earning $800,000.

League Table

article:
Ranil Wickremesinghe is a Sri Lankan politician who has been a dominant figure in the country's politics for over four decades. He has served as the Prime Minister of Sri Lanka a record six times and is the incumbent President of Sri Lanka. Wickremesinghe has been a key player in shaping the country's politics, economy, and foreign policy, and has been a strong advocate for democracy, human rights, and economic development.

#Early life and education

Ranil Wickremesinghe was born on March 24, 1949, in Colombo, Sri Lanka, to a prominent family of politicians and lawyers. His father, Cyril Wickremesinghe, was a lawyer and a member of the State Council, while his mother, Nalini Wickremesinghe, was a schoolteacher. Wickremesinghe's family has a long history of involvement in politics, with his great-grandfather, William Wickremesinghe, serving as a member of the Legislative Council during the British colonial era.

Boys Planet
================

Boys Planet is a South Korean reality competition series that premiered on February 2, 2023, on Mnet. The show is the male counterpart to the Girls Planet 999 series and aims to create a new boy group through a competition among 98 trainees from various entertainment agencies.

Concept and Format
-------------------

Boys Planet features 98 trainees competing against each other to debut in a new boy group. The contestants are divided into two groups: the "Planet Masters," who are experienced trainees, and the "Planet Passengers," who are newer trainees. The show's format consists of various challenges and evaluations, including solo performances, group battles, and vocal and dance competitions.

### Voting System

The contestants are evaluated through a voting system, where the audience and a panel of judges vote for their favorite trainees. The voting system is divided into three periods, with each period featuring a different theme and challenge. The trainees with the lowest votes are eliminated at the end of each period, with the top 9 trainees at the end of the third period debuting as a new boy group.

Promotion and Broadcast

The show premiered on February 2, 2023, and is broadcast every Thursday at 20:00 KST. The show's finale is scheduled to air on April 20, 2023.

article:
Lahaina, Hawaii

Lahaina is a historic town located on the western coast of the island of Maui, Hawaii, United States. With a rich cultural heritage and stunning natural beauty, Lahaina is a popular tourist destination and a significant cultural center in Hawaii. This article provides an overview of the town's history, geography, demographics, arts and culture, sports, and popular culture.

# History

Lahaina's history dates back to the early 19th century, when it was a major center of commerce, politics, and culture in Hawaii.

## Name

### Modern name, etymology and pronunciations

The modern name "Lahaina" is derived from the Hawaiian words "la" meaning "sun" and "haina" meaning "cruel" or "relentless". The name is often pronounced as "lah-HY-nah" or "lah-HAH-nah" by locals and visitors alike.

### Ancient names

In ancient times, the area now known as Lahaina was called "Lele" or "Lelena", which referred to the abundant Maui parrotbill birds that inhabited the area.

## Early rulers

Lahaina was once the capital of the Kingdom of Maui, ruled by the powerful ali'i (chiefs) of Maui. One of the most notable rulers of Lahaina was Pi'ilani, who united the island of Maui under one rule in the 16th century.

## Western contact

### Kahekili II

In 1786, King Kahekili II of Maui, who ruled Lahaina at the time, encountered the first European explorers, including Captain George Vancouver. Kahekili II was known for his fierce resistance to European influence and his efforts to maintain Hawaiian independence.

### Kamehameha I and Kamehameha II

In 1810, King Kamehameha I, who had unified the islands of Hawaii, visited Lahaina and established it as the capital of the Kingdom of Hawaii. His son, Kamehameha II, continued to rule from Lahaina until 1820, when the capital was moved to Honolulu.

### Christian missionaries

In 1820, the first Christian missionaries arrived in Lahaina, led by Hiram Bingham. The missionaries had a significant impact on Hawaiian culture, introducing Christianity and Western education to the islands.

### Whaling

During the 19th century, Lahaina became a major center for the whaling industry, with many ships visiting the town's harbor. The whaling industry brought significant economic growth to the area, but also had a profound impact on the local environment and culture.

### Kamehameha III

In 1825, King Kamehameha III, who ruled from Lahaina, introduced the first written laws in Hawaii, which included the establishment of a constitutional monarchy.

### 20th century

In the 20th century, Lahaina underwent significant changes, including the growth of the tourism industry and the development of new infrastructure. In 1962, the town was officially designated as a historic district, and many of its historic buildings were restored and preserved.

## 2023 wildfire

In August 2023, a devastating wildfire swept through Lahaina, destroying much of the town and forcing thousands of residents and tourists to evacuate. The fire was one of the largest and most destructive in Hawaiian history, and it had a profound impact on the community and the local economy.

# Geography

Lahaina is located on the western coast of Maui, approximately 45 miles northwest of Kahului. The town is situated in a valley surrounded by the West Maui Mountains, which rise to over 5,000 feet in elevation.

## Climate

Lahaina has a tropical savanna climate, characterized by warm temperatures and high levels of humidity throughout the year. The average temperature in Lahaina is around 78°F (25°C), with average annual rainfall of around 20 inches (500 mm).

# Demographics

As of the 2020 United States Census, the population of Lahaina was approximately 12,000 people. The town has a diverse population, with a mix of Native Hawaiians, Asian Americans, and people of European descent.

# Arts and culture

Lahaina is known for its rich cultural heritage, which reflects its history as a major center of commerce, politics, and culture in Hawaii. The town is home to many museums, art galleries, and cultural centers, including the Lahaina Heritage Trail, which showcases the town's historic sites and landmarks.

# Sports

Lahaina is home to several sports teams, including the Lahaina Warriors, which compete in the Maui Interscholastic League. The town also hosts several major sporting events, including the Lahaina Invitational, which attracts top high school basketball teams from around the world.

# Popular culture

Lahaina has been featured in numerous films, television shows, and books, including the popular novel "South Sea Tales" by Robert Louis Stevenson. The town's historic sites and landmarks have also been used as filming locations for several major motion pictures.

article:
Tornado Outbreak of March 21–23, 2022

A significant tornado outbreak affected the Southern United States on March 21–23, 2022. The outbreak produced numerous tornadoes across several states, resulting in widespread damage and loss of life. This article provides an overview of the meteorological conditions that led to the outbreak, the confirmed tornadoes, non-tornadic effects, preparations and impacts, and the aftermath.

# Meteorological Synopsis

The tornado outbreak was caused by a complex weather system that developed over the southern United States on March 20, 2022. A potent low-pressure system formed over the southern Great Plains, bringing with it a mass of warm, moist air from the Gulf of Mexico. As this system interacted with a cold front moving southward from Canada, a powerful storm system developed, producing a large area of thunderstorms across the southern United States.

## March 21

On March 21, a strong upper-level disturbance moved into the southern United States, providing the necessary lift for thunderstorms to develop. As the day progressed, a large area of thunderstorms developed across the southern Great Plains, with some storms becoming supercells. These supercells produced several tornadoes, with the first reported tornado occurring in western Oklahoma.

## March 22

On March 22, the storm system continued to intensify, with a strong low-pressure system developing over eastern Texas. This low-pressure system brought with it a mass of warm, moist air, which fueled the development of thunderstorms across the southeastern United States. As the day progressed, a large area of thunderstorms developed, with some storms becoming supercells. These supercells produced numerous tornadoes, with the hardest-hit areas being eastern Texas, Louisiana, and Mississippi.

## March 23

On March 23, the storm system began to weaken, but not before producing several more tornadoes. The final tornado of the outbreak occurred in southern Alabama. As the storm system moved eastward, it brought heavy rain and strong winds to the eastern United States, causing significant flooding and power outages.

# Confirmed Tornadoes

article:
Attempted Assassination of Imran Khan

The attempted assassination of Imran Khan was a major incident that occurred on November 3, 2022, in Wazirabad, Punjab, Pakistan. Imran Khan, the 22nd Prime Minister of Pakistan, was shot at and injured while leading a protest march towards Islamabad. The incident sent shockwaves across the country and sparked widespread outrage.

# Background

## Ousting of Imran Khan

Imran Khan was ousted as the Prime Minister of Pakistan on April 10, 2022, through a no-confidence vote in the National Assembly. This move was seen as a major setback for Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party, which had been in power since 2018. The ousting was the result of a long-standing feud between Khan and the opposition parties, particularly the Pakistan Muslim League (N) (PML-N) and the Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP). Khan had been facing criticism for his handling of the economy, foreign policy, and governance.

## 2022 Azadi March-II

In response to his ousting, Imran Khan announced a march towards Islamabad, dubbed the "Azadi March-II", to demand fresh elections and protest against the government. The march began on October 28, 2022, from Lahore and was expected to reach Islamabad on November 4. The march was seen as a major challenge to the government, which had imposed Section 144 (prohibiting public gatherings) in several cities. Khan had been leading the march from a container on a truck, addressing crowds and repeating his demands for fresh elections.

# Shooting

On November 3, 2022, while Khan was leading the march in Wazirabad, a gunman opened fire at the container. Khan was shot in the leg and injured, while several others were also wounded. The incident occurred around 4:30 pm local time, when the march was passing through the Wazirabad area. Eyewitnesses reported that the gunman fired multiple shots, and Khan was quickly rushed to a hospital for treatment.

# Suspects

The police arrested a suspect, identified as Naveed, from the scene of the crime. Naveed was reportedly a 40-year-old resident of Wazirabad, who had been identified as a suspect after eyewitnesses reported seeing him firing shots at Khan's container. The police recovered a 9mm pistol from the suspect and claimed that he had confessed to the crime. However, the motive behind the attack was not immediately clear.

# Reactions

## Domestic

The attempted assassination of Imran Khan sparked widespread outrage across Pakistan. PTI supporters took to the streets, protesting against the government and demanding justice for Khan. The opposition parties, including the PML-N and the PPP, condemned the attack and expressed solidarity with Khan. The government, led by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, also condemned the attack and ordered an investigation.

## International

The international community also condemned the attack, with several countries expressing concern for Khan's safety. The United States, the United Kingdom, and China were among the countries that issued statements condemning the attack. The United Nations also issued a statement, expressing concern for the safety of politicians and the need for peaceful dialogue in Pakistan.

article:
Banat of Craiova

The Banat of Craiova was a short-lived administrative division of the Habsburg Empire, established in 1718 and dissolved in 1739. Located in what is now southwestern Romania, the Banat of Craiova was a strategic region that played a significant role in the complex history of the Balkans during the early 18th century.

#History

The history of the Banat of Craiova is marked by periods of conquest, resistance, and eventual reconquest. The region's strategic location made it a prized possession for various empires and powers, leading to a complex and often tumultuous past.

##Austrian conquest

In 1716, the Habsburg Empire, under the leadership of Prince Eugene of Savoy, launched a campaign against the Ottoman Empire, which had controlled the region for nearly two centuries. The Austrians achieved a decisive victory at the Battle of Petrovaradin, and by 1718, they had occupied the region that would become the Banat of Craiova.

##Government creation

Following the conquest, the Habsburgs established the Banat of Craiova as a distinct administrative division, separate from the neighboring Banat of Temesvar. The new government was headed by a governor, who was responsible for implementing imperial policies and maintaining order in the region.

##Boyar and peasant resistance

The establishment of the Banat of Craiova was met with resistance from the local boyar class, who had traditionally held power in the region. The boyars, who were primarily of Romanian and Bulgarian origin, resented the imposition of Austrian rule and the erosion of their privileges. Peasants, who made up the majority of the population, also opposed the Austrian government, which had introduced new taxes and labor obligations.

##Austrian consolidation

Despite the initial resistance, the Austrians were able to consolidate their control over the Banat of Craiova through a combination of military force and administrative reforms. The government implemented policies aimed at promoting economic development, including the establishment of new trade routes and the encouragement of immigration from other parts of the empire.

##Ottoman reconquest

In 1737, the Ottoman Empire, which had been weakened by internal conflicts and external pressures, launched a counterattack against the Austrians. The Ottomans were able to recapture the Banat of Craiova, and the region was returned to Ottoman control. The Austrians were forced to withdraw, and the Banat of Craiova ceased to exist as a distinct administrative division.

#Legacy

The Banat of Craiova played a significant role in shaping the modern history of the Balkans, and its legacy can still be seen today.

##"Colonial" precedent

The establishment of the Banat of Craiova as a colonial-style administration, with a governor and a centralized bureaucracy, set a precedent for later European powers that sought to expand their empires in the region. The Austrians' use of administrative reforms and economic incentives to consolidate their control also influenced later colonial powers.

##Cultural survivals

Despite the brief duration of the Banat of Craiova, the region's cultural heritage was significantly impacted by the Austrian presence. Many of the region's cities, including Craiova, still retain architectural and cultural elements from the Austrian period, including Baroque-style buildings and cultural institutions.

article:
FIDE Grand Prix 2022

The FIDE Grand Prix 2022 is a series of three chess tournaments that form part of the qualification cycle for the 2023 World Chess Championship. The tournaments are organized by the FIDE, the world chess federation, and feature some of the world's top chess players.

# Organization

The FIDE Grand Prix 2022 is organized by the FIDE and consists of three tournaments, each with 16 players. The tournaments are held in Berlin, Germany (February 2022), Belgrade, Serbia (March 2022), and Berlin, Germany (April 2022). The tournaments are part of the 2023 World Chess Championship qualification cycle, with the top two players in the overall standings qualifying for the Candidates Tournament.

# Players

The players participating in the FIDE Grand Prix 2022 are:

* Alexander Grischuk (Russia)
* Anish Giri (Netherlands)
* Andrey Esipenko (Russia)
* Daniil Dubov (Russia)
* Hikaru Nakamura (United States)
* Jan-Krzysztof Duda (Poland)
* Levon Aronian (Armenia)
* Maxime Vachier-Lagrave (France)
* Nikita Vitiugov (Russia)
* Radoslaw Wojtaszek (Poland)
* Richard Rapport (Hungary)
* Sergey Karjakin (Russia)
* Shakhriyar Mamedyarov (Azerbaijan)
* Vidit Gujrathi (India)
* Wesley So (United States)

# Format

The FIDE Grand Prix 2022 features a unique format, with each tournament consisting of a round-robin stage followed by a knockout stage.

## Time controls and tie-breaks

The time control for the round-robin stage is 90 minutes for the first 40 moves, with 30 minutes added for the rest of the game. The time control for the knockout stage is 90 minutes for the first 40 moves, with 30 minutes added for the rest of the game, and a 10-second increment per move. In the event of a tie, the players play a rapid game with a time control of 25 minutes for the entire game, with a 10-second increment per move. If the score is still tied, the players play a blitz game with a time control of 5 minutes for the entire game, with a 3-second increment per move.

## Grand Prix points

The winner of each tournament receives 13 Grand Prix points, with the runner-up receiving 10 points. The third-place finisher receives 7 points, and the fourth-place finisher receives 5 points. The remaining players receive 3, 2, 1, and 0 points, respectively.

## Prize money

The total prize money for each tournament is €150,000, with the winner receiving €24,000. The runner-up receives €18,000, and the third-place finisher receives €12,000.

article:
Vachirawit Chivaaree
================

Vachirawit Chivaaree, commonly known by his nickname Bright, is a Thai actor, singer, and model. He gained widespread recognition for his role as Sarawat in the 2020 Thai television series "2gether: The Series," which became a massive hit globally.

Early Life and Education
------------------------

Vachirawit Chivaaree was born on December 27, 1997, in Bangkok, Thailand. He comes from a family of Chinese descent and has an elder sister. Chivaaree attended the Chulalongkorn University Demonstration Elementary School and later enrolled in the Bachelor of Science in Economics program at Srinakharinwirot University. However, he decided to pursue a career in the entertainment industry instead of completing his degree.

Career and Business Ventures
-----------------------------

### 2013 - 2019: Beginning

Chivaaree began his career in the entertainment industry at the age of 15, working as a model and appearing in various television commercials. He made his acting debut in 2013 with a minor role in the television series "Kluen Cheewit." Over the next few years, he appeared in several television dramas and series, including "Love Sick" and "U-Prince Series."

### 2020: Breakthrough

Chivaaree's breakthrough role came in 2020 when he played the lead character, Sarawat, in the Thai television series "2gether: The Series." The show, which was based on a novel of the same name, tells the story of two college students who pretend to be in a relationship but eventually develop real feelings for each other. The series became a massive hit globally, especially among the LGBTQ+ community, and cemented Chivaaree's status as a rising star in the Thai entertainment industry.

### 2021 - 2023: Rising Popularity

Following the success of "2gether: The Series," Chivaaree appeared in several other television dramas and series, including "F4 Thailand: Boys Over Flowers" and "Astro." He also released several singles, including "Lost and Found" and "Unmovable." Chivaaree's popularity continued to rise, and he became one of the most sought-after actors in the Thai entertainment industry.

### 2024 Onwards: Present

In 2024, Chivaaree announced that he would be starring in a new television series, "Love in the Air," alongside his "2gether: The Series" co-star, Metawin Opas-iamkajorn. The series is expected to premiere later in the year and has already generated significant buzz among fans.

### Business Ventures

In addition to his acting and singing career, Chivaaree has also ventured into business. He has launched his own clothing line, "Bright VC," and has partnered with several other brands to launch limited-edition merchandise.

Artistry
---------

Chivaaree's music style is a blend of pop and R&B. He has released several singles, including "Lost and Found" and "Unmovable," which have become popular among fans. Chivaaree has also performed at several music festivals and concerts, including the "2020 Thailand Music Festival."

Ambassadorships
----------------

### Brand Ventures

Chivaaree has partnered with several brands, including fashion and beauty companies, to launch limited-edition merchandise and promote their products. He has also appeared in several television commercials and print advertisements for various brands.

### 2024 Onwards: Present

In 2024, Chivaaree announced that he would be partnering with a popular beverage company to launch a new line of drinks. He has also partnered with a fashion brand to launch a limited-edition clothing line.

### Endorsements

Chivaaree has endorsed several brands, including fashion and beauty companies. He has appeared in several television commercials and print advertisements for various brands and has also promoted their products on his social media accounts.

### Fashion

Chivaaree has walked the runway for several fashion brands and has appeared in several fashion magazines. He has also launched his own clothing line, "Bright VC," which has become popular among fans.

Philanthropy
------------

Chivaaree has been involved in several charitable activities, including supporting organizations that promote education and healthcare. He has also donated to several charities, including those that support the LGBTQ+ community.

Personal Life
-------------

### Lifestyle and Popularity

Chivaaree is known for his charming and outgoing personality. He is active on social media and often interacts with his fans. Chivaaree's popularity has led to him being named as one of the most influential people in Thailand.

Impact and Influence
----------------------

Chivaaree's impact on the Thai entertainment industry has been significant. He has inspired a new generation of actors and singers and has helped to promote Thai culture globally. Chivaaree's influence extends beyond the entertainment industry, and he has become a role model for many young people in Thailand.
